titles: A speech of VVilliam Thomas, esquire Ianurary, 1641 concerning the right of Bishops sitting and voting in Parliament : wherein hee humbly delivereth his opinion that their sitting and voting there is not onely inconvenient and unlawfull
author: Thomas, William, Sir, d. 1653?
notes: Reproduction of original in Thomason Collection, British Library.
keywords: Church of England --  Bishops --  Temporal power.
Church and state --  England --  Early works to 1800.
